body:
this is a known problem. https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/2877

to fix it edit /config/config.php

```
'maintenance' => true, to 'maintenance' => false,
```

now it should update the database and work again as expected.

if there are more errors during the update process post them here,
duplicate of #2877 as @davidak mentioned. if there _are_ more errors/this isn't a duplicate: reopen this issue.
actually i'm very happy abou this bug report. this means that we finally can reproduce this bug in a good way. @rperezb can you please coordinate with @bartv2 to find a way to fix that? thanks a lot.
test it with ie9 and same issue, maintance mode is shown and by changing the  file config.php maintenance to true, it works.

please test #2835 

it has been open for a month now..

i have managed to reproduce this issue with the version 5.0.6 rc2. 
the steps to reproduce it, the expected and actual behavior are the same that it has indicated @rperezb. 
the server and client configuration is the following one: 

server configuration 
operating system: ubuntu 12.04 
web server: apache 
database: sqlite 
php version: 5.3.10 

client configuration 
browser: firefox, chrome and ie9 
windows 7 

i have done different upgrades from the version 4.5.8 and 5.0.0 (with different browsers), but in all cases the result is the same. 
the browser log (firefox) is:
	
	get http://192.168.1.25/owncloud/ [http/1.1 503 service temporarily unavailable 51ms]
	get http://192.168.1.25/owncloud/core/css/styles.css?v=389bc7bb1e1c2a5e7e147703232a88f6 [http/1.1 304 not modified 2ms]
	get http://192.168.1.25/owncloud/core/css/multiselect.css?v=389bc7bb1e1c2a5e7e147703232a88f6 [http/1.1 304 not modified 2ms]
	get http://192.168.1.25/owncloud/core/css/jquery-ui-1.10.0.custom.css?v=389bc7bb1e1c2a5e7e147703232a88f6 [http/1.1 304 not modified 2ms]
	get http://192.168.1.25/owncloud/core/css/jquery-tipsy.css?v=389bc7bb1e1c2a5e7e147703232a88f6 [http/1.1 304 not modified 3ms]
	get http://192.168.1.25/owncloud/index.php/core/js/config.js?v=389bc7bb1e1c2a5e7e147703232a88f6 [http/1.1 200 ok 29ms]
	get http://192.168.1.25/owncloud/core/js/jquery-1.7.2.min.js?v=389bc7bb1e1c2a5e7e147703232a88f6 [http/1.1 304 not modified 4ms]
	get http://192.168.1.25/owncloud/core/js/jquery-ui-1.10.0.custom.js?v=389bc7bb1e1c2a5e7e147703232a88f6 [http/1.1 304 not modified 3ms]
	get http://192.168.1.25/owncloud/core/js/jquery-showpassword.js?v=389bc7bb1e1c2a5e7e147703232a88f6 [http/1.1 304 not modified 3ms]
	get http://192.168.1.25/owncloud/core/js/jquery.infieldlabel.js?v=389bc7bb1e1c2a5e7e147703232a88f6 [http/1.1 304 not modified 3ms]
	get http://192.168.1.25/owncloud/core/js/jquery-tipsy.js?v=389bc7bb1e1c2a5e7e147703232a88f6 [http/1.1 304 not modified 5ms]
	get http://192.168.1.25/owncloud/core/js/compatibility.js?v=389bc7bb1e1c2a5e7e147703232a88f6 [http/1.1 304 not modified 3ms]
	get http://192.168.1.25/owncloud/core/js/oc-dialogs.js?v=389bc7bb1e1c2a5e7e147703232a88f6 [http/1.1 304 not modified 4ms]

	get http://192.168.1.25/owncloud/core/js/eventsource.js?v=389bc7bb1e1c2a5e7e147703232a88f6 [http/1.1 304 not modified 5ms]
	get http://192.168.1.25/owncloud/core/js/config.js?v=389bc7bb1e1c2a5e7e147703232a88f6 [http/1.1 304 not modified 5ms]
	get http://192.168.1.25/owncloud/search/js/result.js?v=389bc7bb1e1c2a5e7e147703232a88f6 [http/1.1 304 not modified 5ms]
	get http://192.168.1.25/owncloud/core/js/router.js?v=389bc7bb1e1c2a5e7e147703232a88f6 [http/1.1 304 not modified 6ms]
	get http://192.168.1.25/owncloud/core/js/oc-requesttoken.js?v=389bc7bb1e1c2a5e7e147703232a88f6 [http/1.1 304 not modified 6ms]

	get http://192.168.1.25/owncloud/core/img/logo.svg [http/1.1 304 not modified 1ms]
	get http://192.168.1.25/owncloud/core/img/actions/info.png [http/1.1 200 ok 2ms]
	get http://192.168.1.25/owncloud/core/img/breadcrumb.svg [http/1.1 304 not modified 1ms]
@vicdeo do you have an idea what the problem here is?
@fernandoruiz 503 means that error is on the server side. do you have any  errors in the file  owncloud.log under the data folder?

@fernandoruiz 
>the browser displays a message indicating that the upgrade was successful and allows the login on the new version of owncloud.

so the most recent update attempt was successful for the same instance?
i suppose one of the apps crashed the update process. could you recall if some apps were disabled recently in comparison with the previous attempts?

before performing the upgrade, i've deactivated all applications and i have removed all users (except admin) in 4.5.8 owncloud instance. then i have done ​​the upgrade to 5.0.6rc2 and the following message continues appearing indefinitely in the web client.

![16-05-2013 9-57-21](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/3601839/511356/79342472-be00-11e2-8575-3c547607c789.png)

when i refresh the web, the following message is displayed:

![16-05-2013 9-58-23](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/3601839/511361/847cfb6a-be00-11e2-91cf-410bc1bb270a.png)

------

if i start from the same source instance (4.5.8) and perform the upgrade to version 5.0.6 rc1 is when everything works and the web client displays the following message:

![16-05-2013 10-50-14](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/3601839/511523/b95fe9fa-be05-11e2-93ce-3bdc718308f1.png)

i’m closing this issue because it has been inactive for a few months. this probably means that the issue is not reproducible or it has been fixed in a newer version.

please reopen if the error still persists with the [latest stable version](http://owncloud.org/install/) (currently owncloud 5.0.9) and then please use the [issue template](https://raw.github.com/owncloud/core/master/issue_template.md). you an also contribute directly by providing a patch – see the [developer manual](http://doc.owncloud.org/server/5.0/developer_manual/). :)

thank you!
